ai.summary: A demanding 18.7 km hike known as the Fountains Abbey Ancient Trees Walk in the UK. The route combines historic abbey surroundings, ancient woodland and open moorland, delivering a hard, long-distance trekking experience with varied terrain and elevation changes.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied surfaces including gravel paths, grassy fields, woodland trails, stone steps and occasional stiles. Expect uneven ground, damp and muddy sections, and moderate to noticeable elevation changes. Some parts run near historic ruins with potential wildlife and scenic views.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, physically demanding hike. Ensure you are fit for 18.7 km and carry sufficient water and snacks. Wear sturdy, waterproof boots and layered clothing; be prepared for sudden weather changes. Bring a map or offline navigation and a charged phone; stay on marked paths. Watch for slippery surfaces when wet, heed stiles and uneven ground, and supervise children or dogs where allowed. Respect the site and observe any seasonal access restrictions or closures.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map or offline navigation device; compass
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (roughly March to October)

seo.meta_description: Tackle the 18.7 km Fountains Abbey Ancient Trees Walk, a hard trail through abbey ruins, woodlands and ancient trees in the UK. Practical gear tips and safety notes.
seo.h1: Fountains Abbey Ancient Trees Walk (18.7 km, Hard)
